meanings.definition: Use (something) in a way that is incorrect or inappropriate.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally misemployed the hammer as a screwdriver.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to misemploy company funds for personal use.
meanings.sent3: He misemployed the vacuum cleaner to try and fix the leaky faucet.
meanings.sent4: The student misemployed the scientific method in his art project.
meanings.sent5: The chef misemployed salt instead of sugar in the cake batter.

meanings.definition: Employ (someone) in a job or position for which they are not suited.
meanings.sent1: The manager misemployed the new intern by assigning complex tasks.
meanings.sent2: It is unethical to misemploy individuals just to fill a position quickly.
meanings.sent3: She misemployed her cat as a guard dog for the house.
meanings.sent4: The coach misemployed the swimmer as a soccer player in the match.
meanings.sent5: The teacher misemployed the student as a class clown instead of recognizing their potential.
